name: Ramada Caravela Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a week of holidays at the Ramada. Check-in was extremely efficient and after ten minutes, we were in our room and baggage delivered a minute later. The room, category deluxe, was reasonably sized, adjacent to the pool, but quiet, modern-western styled, with large mirrors, no Indian influence (a bit a pity), except for the Goan "Azulejos" in the bathroom. There is a large flat screen TV with many channels, including BBC and CNN, a German, French, but no Spanish channel (Portuguese seems to be forgotten in Goa anyhow). Air conditioning is excellent, very quite and delivers the desired temperature within minutes. There is a coffee maker, coffee is replenished regularly and sufficiently. There is no ironing board and no slippers. Laundry bag had to be ordered, laundry and house holding services good. Bed very comfortable, room service and cleaning twice a day, we never had a complaint. Nice pool landscape, however guests reserve the sun beds with towels shortly after 7 AM, even though there is warning that unused towels will be removed if not used within two hours. The open air jacuzzi is charged at INR 150 for 10 minutes. Breakfast is good, eggs made to order, except that European style crusty bread is missing and the variety of fruit was limited. We had half-board, so we had buffet dinner every night. The majority of dishes is Indian style, quite tasty and delicious. The service is friendly, but not always efficient. There are no smoking sections in the restaurants, even if they are outdoor. But there is a tiny smoking zone just near the pool. There were no theme evenings during our stay, just live bands playing international evergreens and oldies often with playback. Took a glimpse at the casino "Goa Nugget" and the discotheque "Saturday", both were empty, maybe more guests appeared later in the evening? The Sunset Bar is located at the sea front, relaxing and romantic, service sometimes not attentive, depending on the waiter. The garden is large and well groomed, actually it is a golf course, though we never saw anyone playing. The beach is lovely, not crowded, and appears endless. The sand is whitish, except near the waterline it is slightly tainted grey presumably from an oil spill some years ago, what a pity. It is quite clean, because in front of the hotel, the hotel staff picks up litter every morning. The ocean was quite calm and swimming possible at all times. There are strong undercurrents. There are some beach shacks nearby, we chose the "Sabores de Goa" 200 meters to the South, which is very price worthy and serves excellent food, e.g. fresh tiger prawns, delicious French fries, aloo gobi, etc. You can use their sun beds free, you will be expected to take a drink or so at the shack. The beach peddlers are less aggressive then up North, but they do ask for two or three times the price you would pay e.g. in Margao, so you must bargain. The taxis near the hotel are expensive, a drive to Margao and back cost us INR 900, plus 50 INR per hour waiting. In Margao a taxi offered a one-way drive for INR 250. In Varca, a taxi asked for INR 300 for half the distance. But the hotel taxis are comfortable with air-con and reliable, educated drivers, etc., and compared to taxis in European cities, they still are affordable and walking to Varca will not guarantee you find a cheap taxi. The three-wheel motor rickshaws seem to have disappeared. A word to the tips in general: We gave tips of INR 30 - 100, depending on the service, which was usually highly appreciated, in average, INR 50 will be adequate. Guests at the hotel were mainly British, German, Indian, Swiss, etc., plus a large Russian community. The hotel personnel is very friendly, even the garden workers greet when you walk by. Overall, it was a very enjoyable and relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Comfortable

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ramada Caravela between 14th-21st November 2008 and cannot fault it. Prior to arriving there we had spent one week undertaking the really enjoyable but exhausting Taj Tour (Delhi, Agra & Jaipur golden triangle) organised by Kuoni so was ready for some relaxation and tranquility in Goa.
reviews.title: AMAZING TIME AND FELT VERY SPECIAL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We there for a visit to south Goa. The place was absolutely beautiful. We got the deluxe rooms, they're newly renovated and absolutely clean and gorgeous! The service was prompt and attentive. We booked ourselves on the full board. It was a buffet set up, but gourmet! which was very surprising considering how buffet's are notorious for being boring and unpalatable.
reviews.title: Quaint relaxed place

likes.disliked: — They gave 1 bottle of mineral water a day for consumption, there were no shops close by and repleshing the water cost a fortune!

reviews.text: The hotel's beach was a pretty expanse and secluded. Our room had a little patio that opened out onto the lawns. All in all it was an amazing place to stop at to take in sleepy South Goa and some RnR.
reviews.title: Perfect holiday

reviews.text: This hotel has excellent staff is spotless and has lots of ameneties for daytime relaxation or activity(depending on personal choice).Its night time entertainment is low key but certainly suited to this class of Hotel.There are several Beach Shacks and Restaurants near to the Hotel if you wish to eat out or travel a short distance to lively Cavelosem .Breakfast is very good and again staff superb.The beach is beautiful and no shortage of sunbeds .
reviews.title: A holiday to remember

reviews.text: Returned on Sunday from the Ramada Caravela Beach Resort in South Goa, where my husband and myself had one of the best holidays we have had.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at the Ramada. The welcome from staff was great! Actually, the staff was great through the entire stay! Check-in was easy and we were told they had upgraded our room. The lobby and all common areas of the hotel were beautiful.
reviews.title: Great stay, beach was fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked through the well kept grounds to our building and up to the second floor. The hallway was dark and the rugs were stained, not a great first impression (later I found the other buildings, closer to the lobby, to have the better rooms and nicer hallways). The room was nice, not fantastic. Everything was clean and updated. There was no musty smell. We had a nice terrace that overlooked the tropical grounds. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were clean. The bathroom was great and the water was always hot.
reviews.title: An excellent place to stay

likes.disliked: — Having to grab a sunlounger early in the morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was great but the pool is not heated. Be prepared for the water to be a little cold if traveling between December and March. I was not impressed with the hot tub, it was not hot and was about 10 degrees warmer than the pool. The beach was fantastic, it was private so the solicitors could only come so close. There were umbrellas and beach chairs available everyday. There are also a couple little snack shacks close by. I would recommend getting a drink (they are about 50-75% less than the hotel) but not any food.
reviews.title: too isolated
